availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Woods (Hamilton County, Ohio, merchant and paper dealer)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, paper dealer. Maryland native. Married to Elizabeth Woods. Father of Ella Woods, John S. Woods, William H. Woods, Sally C. Woods, Harry F. Woods, and Lizzie Woods. Merchant in Cincinnati in 1850. Partner in the firm of Nixon & Chatfield in Cincinnati until May 1, 1860. Paper dealer in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed John Cushman, Sarah Griffith, Mary Hally, and Louisa Hally as servants in Cincinnati in 1860. Employed Ellen Bemis as a seamstress in Cincinnati in 1860. Partner in the firm of Nixon, Chatfield & Woods in Cincinnati from June 13, 1860, to June 7, 1865. Partner in the firm of Chatfield & Woods in Cincinnati on June 7, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 5, p. 419A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 15, p. 392.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton, Cincinnati Ward 15, p. 507B.
Find A Grave, "William W. Woods (1817-1902)," Memorial #37528706, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/37528706 (accessed May 7, 2020).
Cincinnati Daily Press (Cincinnati, OH), June 13, 1860.
The Cincinnati Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), June 7, 1865.
